prompt: I run a plumbing company called Boston Best Plumbing. Website is bostonbestplumbing.com. We serve Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville. Our main services are emergency plumbing, drain cleaning, and water heater installation/repair. Help me create an SEO strategy.
expectations: Performs keyword research for plumbing services in those 3 cities
Clusters keywords by intent (emergency vs. planned, informational vs. transactional)
Creates a service + location page architecture (3 services × 3 cities + hubs)
Identifies competitor gaps in the local plumbing market
Provides internal linking strategy connecting service and location pages
Outputs structured page list with priorities (P0, P1, P2)
Maps keywords to specific pages with primary and secondary targets
Creates execution checklist with realistic timeline
Delivers outputs in spreadsheet format (.xlsx) for page list and keyword map
Recommends quick wins (low competition opportunities)

prompt: We're a SaaS company offering project management software at projectflow.io. National market, no location focus. Main features are task management, time tracking, team collaboration, and reporting. Our competitors are Asana, Monday.com, and Trello. Create an SEO content strategy.
expectations: Research keywords around project management software and features
Clusters by intent (comparison pages, feature pages, use case pages, educational)
Creates page architecture appropriate for SaaS (not location-based)
Includes competitor comparison pages (vs Asana, Monday, Trello)
Identifies content gaps competitors aren't covering well
Maps keywords to pages with clear intent labels
Designs hub-and-spoke internal linking for topical authority
Prioritizes pages based on funnel stage (awareness → decision)
Outputs include page list, keyword map, and execution plan
Addresses how to compete with established brands

prompt: Personal injury law firm with offices in Miami, Fort Lauderdale, West Palm Beach, and Tampa. Website is floridalawyers.com. We handle car accidents, slip and fall, medical malpractice, and wrongful death cases. Create our SEO strategy.
expectations: Researches legal keywords with appropriate commercial intent
Creates service + location architecture for 4 practice areas × 4 cities
Understands legal SEO considerations and competitive landscape
Clusters keywords by case type and intent
Identifies which service+location combinations have actual search demand
Recommends avoiding thin content across too many combinations
Creates internal linking strategy appropriate for legal content
Maps high-intent keywords (hiring intent) to priority pages
Provides realistic timeline given content review requirements in legal
Includes FAQ pages for common legal questions (informational intent)

prompt: E-commerce site selling outdoor camping and hiking gear at trailmaster.com. Products include tents, backpacks, sleeping bags, hiking boots, and camping accessories. National audience. What's our SEO content strategy?
expectations: Creates category-based page architecture (not location-based)
Identifies buying intent keywords (best, reviews, buying guide)
Recommends comparison pages and buying guides
Maps informational content (how to choose, guides) to support product pages
Creates internal linking from guides to relevant products
Identifies competitor gaps in content or product coverage
Structures keywords by product category and use case
Recommends seasonal content opportunities
Provides page list with product categories and supporting content
Focuses on transactional and commercial investigation intents

prompt: Need SEO strategy for my digital marketing agency in Austin. URL is austindigital.co
expectations: Asks clarifying questions about services offered
Asks about target locations (Austin only or broader?)
Asks about competitors or specific goals
Still provides useful directional strategy with limited information
Makes reasonable assumptions about digital marketing services
Creates page structure appropriate for agency (services + maybe locations)
Identifies typical digital marketing agency keywords
Provides framework that can be refined with more input
Explains what additional information would improve the strategy

prompt: I'm a dentist in Seattle (seattlesmiledental.com). My main competitors are Aspen Dental and local practices ranking well. I want to know what content gaps exist that I can exploit.
expectations: Analyzes competitor content strategies
Identifies topics competitors rank for with weak content
Finds question-based keywords competitors don't answer
Recommends specific pages to create based on gaps
Prioritizes gaps by opportunity (volume + winnability)
Includes both service-based and informational gaps
Maps gap opportunities to specific page recommendations
Provides rationale for why each gap is exploitable
Creates execution priority based on ROI potential

prompt: We have a large educational site with 200+ articles about personal finance. URL is moneysmart.org. We need an internal linking strategy to organize this content and build topical authority around key topics like investing, budgeting, credit cards, and taxes.
expectations: Creates hub-and-spoke architecture for main topics
Identifies which pages should be hubs vs. supporting content
Designs link flow from homepage → hubs → spoke pages
Recommends pillar pages for each main topic
Maps lateral linking between related subtopics
Explains link distribution strategy (authority flow)
Identifies any orphan content to reconnect
Creates actionable linking checklist
Prioritizes linking updates by impact
Addresses how to avoid over-linking

prompt: Create SEO strategy for a roofing company (roofexperts.com) serving Dallas and Houston. Services: roof repair, replacement, inspection. I need everything in spreadsheet format.
expectations: Creates output in .xlsx spreadsheet format
Includes tabs for page list, keyword research, keyword mapping, and competitors
Page list includes URL structure, priority levels, status
Keyword map shows primary/secondary keywords per page
Structured data is organized in columns (not just text in cells)
Provides execution checklist as additional output
Uses appropriate formatting (headers, filters, etc.)
Data is actionable and ready to work from
